{{Infobox officeholder |name = Faisal Naseem |office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]]
{{small|Elect}} |term_start = 17 November 2018 |president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] {{small|(Elect)}} |succeeding = [[Abdulla Jihad]] |birth_date = July 20, 1973 (age 45)
[[Maldives]] |alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]]
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician serving as the [[Vice President of the Maldives|Vice President]]-elect of the [[Maldives]], following the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|election]] of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on September 23, 2018. He is set to assume office on November 17, 2018, and will succeed the outgoing [[Abdulla Jihad]].https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/ Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Early Life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu district]] of the Maldives on July 20, 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.http://vnews.mv/100965

In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008.

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Faisal Naseem |office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]]
{{small|Elect}} |term_start = 17 November 2018 |president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] {{small|(Elect)}} |succeeding = [[Abdulla Jihad]] |birth_date = July 20, 1973 (age 45)

In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful conpletetion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo]].http://vnews.mv/100965

In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful conpletetion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo]].http://vnews.mv/100965 On July 13, 2018, Naseem was chosen as the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]]’s vice presidential candidate. ==References==

He is set to assume office on November 17, 2018, and will succeed the outgoing [[Abdulla Jihad]].https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/ Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Early Life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] of the Maldives on July 20, 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.http://vnews.mv/100965 ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful conpletetion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].http://vnews.mv/100965 On July 13, 2018, Naseem was chosen as the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]]’s vice presidential candidate.https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/ ==References== [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]]

He is set to assume office on 17 November 2018, and will succeed the outgoing [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews}} ==Early Life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] of the Maldives on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful conpletetion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]]’s vice presidential candidate.{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} |party = [[Jumhooree Party]] |occupation = }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician serving as the [[Vice President of the Maldives|Vice President]]-elect of the [[Maldives]], following the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|election]] of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 Swptember 2018. He is set to assume office on 17 November 2018, and will succeed the outgoing [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews}} ==Early Life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful conpletetion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih’s vice presidential candidate for the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih’s vice presidential candidate for the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]]
{{small|Elect}} | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] {{small|(Elect)}} | succeeding = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])}}
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives|Vice President]]-elect of the [[Maldives]], following the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He is set to assume office on 17th November 2018, and will succeed the outgoing [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews}} ==Early Life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution’s successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih’s vice presidential candidate for the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih’s vice presidential candidate for the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews}} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[Maldivian presidential election, 2018|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives|Vice President]] of the [[Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews}} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives|Vice President]] of the [[Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives since 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = | office2 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] constituency | deputy2 = | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] (elect) | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])}}
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives since 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = | office2 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] constituency | deputy2 = | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] (elect) | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])}}

Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25th February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25th February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25th February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023. ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, on [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

revision.comment: He is still Vice-President and will leave Office on 17th November 2023.
revision.text:
{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives since 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_end = ''17 November 2023'' | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = [[Hussain Mohamed Latheef]] | office2 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] constituency | deputy2 = | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] (elect) | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])}}
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] {{small|([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]])}} | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25th February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023. ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

revision.comment: [[MOS:SMALL]], Do not add the end date until his term ends per [[WP:CRYSTAL]], per [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)/Archive 175 #RfC: Interim use of successor in Infobox officeholder|RfC]] the successor should not be added until he assumes office

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives since 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_end = | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = | office2 = Member of [[People's Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] constituency | deputy2 = | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] ([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023. ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives since 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_end = | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = | office2 = Member of [[People's Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] constituency | deputy2 = | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[University of Birmingham]] ([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]])
[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023. ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Birmingham]]

[[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician }} '''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who is the [[Vice President of the Maldives]], following the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|election]] of President [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] on 23 September 2018. He assumed office on 17 November 2018, and succeeded the former Vice President [[Abdulla Jihad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}} Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}} Vice President Faisal fulfilled the responsibilities of the President for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }} He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023. ==Early life== Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]]. ==Career== Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador. Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}} ==Politics== Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]]. On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}} ==References== {{commons category}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Naseem, Faisal}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Maldivian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Birmingham]]
