{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives from 2018 to 2023}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | term_end = 17 November 2023 | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = [[Hussain Mohamed Latheef]] | office2 = Member of the [[People's Majlis]] | constituency2 = [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = Abdulla Jabir | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician | alma_mater = | education = {{plainlist| * [[University of Birmingham]] ([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]]) * [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) }} }}
'''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who served as [[vice president of the Maldives]] from 2018 to 2023. He was elected to office as the running mate of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] in the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}}</ref> Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.<ref name="vnews.mv">{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>
As vice president, Naseem fulfilled the responsibilities of the president for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }}</ref> He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023.
==Early life==
Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
==Career==
Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.<ref>{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}}</ref>
==Politics==
Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>

He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.<ref>{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}}</ref>
==Politics==
Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives from 2018 to 2023}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | term_end = 17 November 2023 | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = [[Hussain Mohamed Latheef]] | office2 = Member of the [[People's Majlis]] | constituency2 = [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = Abdulla Jabir | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician | alma_mater = | education = {{plainlist| * [[University of Birmingham]] ([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]]) * [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) }} }}
'''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who served as [[vice president of the Maldives]] from 2018 to 2023. He was elected to office as the running mate of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] in the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}}</ref> Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.<ref name="vnews.mv">{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>
As vice president, Naseem fulfilled the responsibilities of the president for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }}</ref> He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023.
==Early life==
Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] division of the Maldives, in [[Fuvahmulah]] Island, on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Naseem went on to complete his higher studies in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
==Career==
Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
Faisal Naseem is also a craftsman, architect and interior designer, and has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences.<ref>{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}}</ref>
==Politics==
Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>

'''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who served as [[vice president of the Maldives]] from 2018 to 2023. He was elected to office as the running mate of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] in the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}}</ref> Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.<ref name="vnews.mv">{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>
As vice president, Naseem fulfilled the responsibilities of the president for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }}</ref> He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023.
==Early life==
Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] district in [[Fuvahmulah]] on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Nadeem pursued tertiary education in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
==Career==
Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
His political career began in 2004 when he was elected to parliament representing Fuvahmulah.
After the 2018 election, he was appointed vice president. He briefly carried out presidential duties when president Ibrahim Mohamed Solih underwent surgery. Naseem is remembered as the longest serving vice president of the Maldives having served a complete 5 year term following the democratization reforms that gave way for multi-party elections in 2008.
Faisal Naseem is also a skilled craftsman, architect and interior designer. He has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences, and as of recent, the Millennium guest house in Fuvahmulah.<ref>{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}}</ref>
==Politics==
Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>

He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>
Naseem is remembered as the longest serving vice president of the Maldives having served a complete 5 year term following the democratization reforms that gave way for multi-party elections in 2008.

{{Short description|Vice President of the Maldives from 2018 to 2023}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Faisal Naseem | image = Faisal Naseem portrait.jpg | caption = | office = [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start = 17 November 2018 | term_end = 17 November 2023 | predecessor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | successor = [[Hussain Mohamed Latheef]] | office2 = Member of the [[People's Majlis]] | constituency2 = [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2014 | term_end2 = 16 November 2018 | predecessor2 = Abdulla Jabir | successor2 = [[Abdulla Jabir]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|7|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Funaadu]], [[Fuvahmulah]], [[Maldives]] | party = [[Jumhooree Party]] | occupation = Politician | alma_mater = | education = {{plainlist| * [[University of Birmingham]] ([[Bachelor of Arts#United Kingdom and Ireland|BA]]) * [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]] ([[Master of Business Administration|MBA]]) }} }}
'''Faisal Naseem''' (born 20 July 1973) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who served as [[vice president of the Maldives]] from 2018 to 2023. He was elected to office as the running mate of [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] in the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|title=Maldives' president concedes loss to opposition candidate|date=23 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Vancouver Courier|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220023/https://www.vancourier.com/maldives-president-concedes-loss-to-opposition-candidate-1.23440343|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://montrealgazette.com/pmn/news-pmn/calm-opposition-leader-wins-maldives-presidency-amid-storm/wcm/9b70d466-d2da-4160-affb-4abdc43da567|title=Calm opposition leader wins Maldives presidency amid storm|date=24 September 2018|website=Montreal Gazette}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/photos/world-news/maldives-election-surprise-victory-for-opposition-leader-solih-5373062/|title=Maldives election: Surprise victory for opposition leader Solih|date=25 September 2018|publisher=Associated Press|via=Indian Express}}</ref> Prior to his election, Naseem served for many years in the social sector, particularly in tourism.<ref name="vnews.mv">{{cite web|url=http://vnews.mv/100965|title=Faisal Naseem – A son the entire nation should be proud of|date=15 July 2018|website=vNews|access-date=25 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180925220101/http://vnews.mv/100965|archive-date=25 September 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref>
As vice president, Naseem fulfilled the responsibilities of the president for 3 hours and 30 minutes on 25 February 2022 when the president underwent a medical procedure.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/26327 | title=The President temporarily transfers power to the Vice President }}</ref> He is the longest serving vice president in Maldivian history as of 2023.
==Early life==
Faisal Naseem was born in the [[Funaadu]] district in [[Fuvahmulah]] on 20 July 1973. In 1986, at age 12, Naseem joined the social sector {{Citation needed|date=July 2023}}. Nadeem pursued tertiary education in the [[United Kingdom]], receiving a bachelor's degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management from the [[University of Birmingham]], and a master's degree in Business Administration from the [[Cardiff Metropolitan University]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
==Career==
Prior to studying in England, Naseem joined the hospitality industry, serving in positions ranging from assistant manager to general manager. He joined the hospitality industry to become better familiar with his field of choice, which is where he would spend the majority of his career. In recognition of his work, Naseem was awarded the National Youth Award in social services in 1999, and received a “Special Recognition” award in 2015. In 2014, he was named a Disability Ambassador.<ref name="vnews.mv"/>
Faisal Naseem is also a skilled craftsman, architect and interior designer. He has previously worked on the construction of various guesthouses, resorts and residences, and as of recent, the Millennium guest house in Fuvahmulah.<ref>{{Cite news |date=24 August 2022 |title=Vice President’s craftsmanship as seen at ‘Millennium’ |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/features/25385}}</ref>
==Politics==
Naseem entered the political field in 2004, becoming one of the members to represent the [[Fuvahmulah#Municipal divisions|Fuvahmulah Constituency]] during the drafting of a new constitution from 2004 - 2008. After the constitution's successful completion, he stayed away from politics for the next 5 years. He rejoined the parliament again in 2014, serving as the MP for [[Kaashidhoo (Kaafu Atoll)|Kaashidhoo]].<ref name="vnews.mv"/> On 13 July 2018, Naseem was chosen as Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's vice presidential candidate for the [[2018 Maldivian presidential election|2018 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://newsin.asia/jumhoory-party-chooses-faisal-naseem-to-be-running-mate-of-joint-maldivian-opposition-presidential-candidate-solih/|title=Jumhoory Party chooses Faisal Naseem to be running mate of Joint Maldivian Opposition Presidential candidate Solih|date=13 July 2018|website=newsin.asia}}</ref>
Naseem is remembered as the longest serving vice president of the Maldives having served a complete 5 year term following the democratization reforms that gave way for multi-party elections in 2008.
